text.__SUMMARY__: The lenis woolly bat (Kerivoula lenis) is a species of bat in the family Vespertilionidae. It is found in India and Malaysia.
text.Taxonomy and etymology:
It was described as a new species in 1916 by British zoologist Oldfield Thomas.
Its species name "lenis" is Latin for "soft."
text.Range and habitat:
It is found in South and Southeast Asia in India, Malaysia, and Indonesia.
